key_risks: Environmental and regulatory risks, including deforestation, water usage, and emissions
Financial and legal risks from ongoing litigation and insider trading activity
Operational risks due to raw material cost volatility and competitive pressures
Ethical and social risks from labor disputes and employment discrimination cases
controversies: $91.8 million jury verdict for a 2017 explosion at its DeRidder mill
Insider trading activity by SVP Joseph Vaughn
Unfair labor practice case filed with the National Labor Relations Board
Discrimination lawsuit by the U.S. EEOC
social_issues: Labor disputes and unfair labor practices
governance_issues: Insider trading activity raising concerns about management confidence

sources.title: PCA to appeal $91.8M payout verdict for Louisiana ... - Packaging Dive
sources.snippet: Packaging Corporation of America plans to appeal an April 24 jury verdict to award $91.8 million in compensatory damages plus prejudgment interest to nine survivors of a deadly February 2017 explosion at the company's pulp mill in DeRidder, Louisiana, according to the company's updated quarterly report filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday.
